summary: I am an ambitious and driven individual that aims to build my career within human resources and managerial practices. My passion is organisational effectiveness and employee engagement and retention. I have worked within various multicultural and multifunctional teams and groups and have proven to be self-disciplined, organised, hard-working and determined.

publications.name: Transforming while transferring: An exploratory study of how transferability of skills is key in the transformation of higher education

profile_positions.description:
Recruitment
• Partner with the hiring manager and HR Business Partners to define the position, review the job description
and discuss the approach for the recruitment to attract the most talented people from around the world
•Be owner of our LinkedIn career page and actively post vacancies and/or connect with agencies when
needed
• Set up your own network and build trusted relationships with candidates to create talent pools
• Screen candidates, schedule and conduct interviews and guarantee the quality and lead time of theselection process
•Provide timely updates to hiring managers with information on the hiring process and come up withsolutions if hiring is challenging
• Provide timely updates to candidates with information regarding the status of open vacancies and planning
• Identify recruitment process and onboarding issues and make recommendations for improvement
• Supporting the Compensation & Benefit specialist with job weighing
• Build networks with schools, in order to establish a talent pool for our entry-level and internship positions
• Set up and maintain recruitment reporting, through our HR system.

HR Operations
• Support international candidates with their relocation to Head Office
• Arranging and leading the onboarding process and guiding the off boarding process with employees so theyhave a pleasurable experience both entering and leaving the company
• Set up internal procedures to streamline the onboarding process and administration in the HR department
• Take care of all the administration before, during and after the onboarding, including setting up vacancytexts, providing job offers, arranging employment contracts, requesting VOG, support in visa procedures
and 30% ruling requests, setting up employee accounts
• Answer employee questions coming in from different sources
• Support in other HR processes, supporting the HR Business Partners, the L&D specialist and theCompensation & Benefits specialist
profile_positions.title: Recruitment & HR Operations Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Training and Development
Organise and facilitate in-house training and development activities
Organise external training
Mapping out and develop internal training manuals, e-learning materials and course outlines as required for various training purposes
Liaising with department heads to identify training needs and evaluate information from employees and management to identify weaknesses and areas that require additional training
Track and create reports on outcomes of training and maintain training records
Inform employees on scheduled training and track their progress
Market and communicate company training opportunities to employees 
Train new employees on company policies and procedures, company description and overview
Ensure training and development initiatives align with the company values and overall strategic goals

Reporting and WSP/ATR Submission
Facilitate and monitor performance evaluation process
Undertake the role of Secondary Skills Development Facilitator
Assist with the annual WSP/ATR for the relevant TETA
Maintain accurate training records for the organisation including proof of payments and registrations
Maintain the training matrix and training plans for the organisation
Build strong relationships with relevant training agencies and TETA
Administering Learnerships and Internships in the organisation to ensure compliance and that KPIS are being met
Assist in planning annual sales and management training conferences

Standard Operating Procedures
Conduct organization-wide assessment on department standard operating procedures 
Liaise with employees and department heads and assist to draft, implement and formalise SOPs 
Develop and assist in maintaining SOPs database and records

General HR Support
Support on day-to-day basis and contributing to the long-run development of HR function 
Raising Purchase orders and receipting and staying within monthly financial timelines
Assisting with monthly and facilitating year end BEE audits
profile_positions.title: Learning and Development Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Provide support for a wide variety of activities of human resources including employee relations, recruiting, and administration of benefits.
Maintain the personal records of employees on matters such as training, new hire forms, EEA1, contracts, etc.
Provide information to employees on HR policies and procedures
Ensure the maintenance of employee life cycle
Support on day-to-day basis and contributing to the long-run development of HR function 
or HR system for maintaining accurate records.
Assist the HR Manager with the maintenance and development of HR procedures and policies.
Assisting with monthly and facilitating year end BEE audits
Drafting of HR Policies and SOP’s
Posting and advertising open positions and assisting in recruitment process.
Assist with staff inductions and preparation of materials.
Ensure job descriptions are accurate and updated when required.
Developing and maintaining good relationship with employment agencies and other recruitment resources.
Writing ads and posting open positions, drafting offer letters for new hires.
Participating in interviews as required and assisting managers in identifying and creating job related interview questions.
Ensuring the execution of all pre-employment checks are done
Checking applicant references, making job offers and initiating needed paperwork.
Ensure all staff have a fully integrated induction process with timely feedback sessions
Ensure job descriptions are accurate and updated at least annually. 
Undertake the role of Secondary Skills Development Facilitator, assist with the annual WSP/ATR 
Maintain accurate training records for the organisation including proof of payments and registrations.
Build strong relationships with relevant training agencies
Administering Learnerships and Internships in the organisation to ensure compliance and that KPIS are being met.
Assist in planning annual sales and management training conferences.
profile_positions.title: HR Administrator

profile_positions.location: East London, Eastern Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
HR Administrator
Handling all contracts and disciplinary procedures per payroll client
Managing client accounts with regards to all HR queries and requirements
Managing employee folders and administration
Development of training materials, guides, and presentations
Evaluation of existing training materials and methods to identify potential for improvement
Strong critical thinking skills aid in assessing the strengths and weaknesses of approaches to problems and the viability of various solutions
Creating effective business plans for their company. 
Assess potential clients and provide development support
Act as a facilitator between executives and external contracting sources. 
Process large amounts of company data to make predictions and create detailed reports. 
Recommending changes to management, including HR, operations, Supply chain, Financial, etc.
Participate in business meetings, and recommend changes to existing business practices to increase exposure and revenue
Processing and submission of mandatory grants 

Payroll Administrator
Aiding with the processing of employee data in uploading and updating employee files and information
Capturing employee banking details onto VIP Payroll
Importing of timesheets onto Payroll 
Ensuring information is accurate and up to date
Responding to queries from employees regarding payroll, HR and administration
Assisting with weekly and monthly Payroll of staff
Managing client accounts and updating client information 
Handling payroll client Billing sheets and processing sheets for invoicing
Attending client and internal payroll meetings to establish action plans, respond to queries, manage client relations, etc.
Managing all department of labour reports in terms of IOD claims, UIF applications and any others
Aiding with the processing and development of reports for all company and client requirements such as management reports, weekly reports
Handling all BCM and company related queries and requirements
profile_positions.title: HR and Payroll Administrator

profile_positions.description:
Recruitment:
Sourcing for potential candidates across various industries including Automotive, FMCG, Medical, Finance, Retail, Marketing, Media, etc.
Researching and staying up to date with market requirements and trends 
Formatting of CVs - also offer professional CV service
Cold Calling
Client and candidate liaising 
Telesales
Visiting candidates and clients 
Screening and interviewing candidates

IR and HR Consulting:
Disciplinary procedures and hearings - handling warnings, hearings and dismissals
Implementing performance appraisals and reviews 
EE Consultations and Development Plans
Business development and growth analysis and reports
Labour Relations Consultant 
Researching and reporting on organisational processes, organograms and processes.
Providing data and information on analysis for company review
Suggesting strategies to increase organisational development, human capital, etc.
profile_positions.title: Talent Acquisition Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Sourcing and researching about qualified candidates according to specifications in terms of:
Current Development Language (in the IT-related field)
Area of expertise
Qualifications
Accuracy of information provided
Desired work areas, etc.

•	CV analysis and formatting
•	Candidate marketing in terms of blurbs and word-of-mouth appraisal
•	Liaising between client and candidate
•	Scheduling interviews and forwarding assessments and feedback to both the client and the candidate
•	Negotiating and discussing offers of employment with both client and candidate
•	Formatting Word Documentation, PDFs and Excel Spreadsheets
•	Research current trends within relevant field
•	Creating advertisements and posting them on career portals as well as LinkedIn
•	Take part in daily meetings
•	Attend client meetings
•	Forming and maintaining professional relationships with clients and candidates
•	Conduct reference checks on successful candidates on client’s behalf
•	Conduct background checks on successful candidates on client’s behalf
•	Calculating invoices fees for clients on Placement of candidates - This is according to their Annual Expected CTC, our company agreed terms and percentage of service as well as the VAT rate
•	Negotiating and discussing contracts and terms with both clients and candidates - This is in terms of employee obligation forms (MIE, Candidate Application Forms as well as Company Service Legal Agreement)
•	Business Development
profile_positions.title: IT Recruitment Consultant
